Meters module

class Meters.Meter(metertype: str, metername: str, host: str, measurements: list, port: int, addressBook: dict, slave: int)

Bases: object

A class dedicated to programming and storing information an a specific PQMII meter.

Parameters:

  • metertype (str) – The type of meter associated with this class

  • metername (str) – The name of the meter associated with this class

  • host (str) – The unique IP address associated with the meter

  • measurements (list) – A list of measurements the user would like this meter to record

  • port (int) – The port associated with the meter, defaults to 502

  • addressBook (dict) – A JSON file that holds the modbus memory map—the register addresses of every measurement

  • slave (int) – The slave number associated with this meter or submeter

bitData32()
connectToMeter()

Connects to this specific meter and returns the connection test and the modbus client.

Returns:

Returns a tuple, in the following format (connection, client)

Return type:

(bool, ModbusTcpClient)

getData()
getDatetime()

Retrieves the meter’s current datetime stored in its internal clock

Returns:

The complete datetime in the following format: yy-mm-dd hh:mm

Return type:

str

Note

Todo: Restructure this to compensate for the different addresses for the different meters. Write a function to find the address given the metertype
